lib/btsp/feasible.c

00001 /**********************************************************doxygen*//** @file
00002  * @brief   Bottleneck traveling salesman problem (BTSP) methods.
00003  *
00004  * Heuristic for solving the bottleneck traveling salesman problem (BTSP).
00005  *
00006  * @author  John LaRusic
00007  * @ingroup lib
00008  ****************************************************************************/
00009 #include "common.h"
00010 #include "btsp.h"
00011 
00012 /****************************************************************************
00013  * Public function implementations
00014  ****************************************************************************/
00015 int
00016 arrow_btsp_feasible(arrow_problem *problem, int num_steps, 
00017                     arrow_btsp_solve_plan *steps, int min_cost, int max_cost, 
00018                     int *feasible, arrow_btsp_result *result)
00019 {
00020     //printf("Feasible?: %d <= C[i,j] <= %d\n", min_cost, max_cost);
00021     //printf("is_symmetric = %d; size = %d;\n", problem->symmetric, problem->size);
00022     
00023     int ret = ARROW_SUCCESS;
00024     int i, j, k;
00025     int u, v;
00026     int cost;
00027     double len;
00028        
00029     *feasible = ARROW_FALSE;
00030     result->found_tour = ARROW_FALSE;
00031     result->max_cost = INT_MIN;
00032     result->max_cost = INT_MAX;
00033     result->tour_length = DBL_MAX;
00034     for(i = 0; i < ARROW_TSP_SOLVER_COUNT; i++)
00035     {
00036         result->solver_attempts[i] = 0;
00037         result->solver_time[i] = 0.0;
00038     }
00039     result->total_time = 0.0;
00040     
00041     /* This holds the current tour that was found and its length */
00042     arrow_tsp_result tsp_result;
00043     arrow_tsp_result_init(problem, &tsp_result);
00044     
00045     arrow_debug("Feasibility problem for %d <= C[i,j] <= %d\n", min_cost, max_cost);
00046     for(i = 0; i < num_steps; i++)
00047     {
00048         arrow_btsp_solve_plan *plan = &(steps[i]);
00049         arrow_btsp_fun *fun = &(plan->fun);
00050                 
00051         arrow_debug("Step %d of %d:\n", i + 1, num_steps);
00052         
00053         for(j = 1; j <= plan->attempts; j++)
00054         {
00055             arrow_debug("Attempt %d of %d:\n", j, plan->attempts);
00056             
00057             /* Create a new problem based upon the solve plan */
00058             arrow_problem new_problem;
00059             if(!arrow_btsp_fun_apply(fun, problem, min_cost, max_cost, &new_problem))
00060             {
00061                 ret = ARROW_FAILURE;
00062                 goto CLEANUP;
00063             }
00064                                                     
00065             /* Call a TSP solver on new problem */      
00066             ret = arrow_tsp_solve(plan->tsp_solver, &new_problem, 
00067                                   plan->tsp_params, &tsp_result);
00068             if(!ret)
00069             {
00070                 ret = ARROW_FAILURE;
00071                 arrow_tsp_result_destruct(&tsp_result);
00072                 arrow_problem_destruct(&new_problem);
00073                 goto CLEANUP;   
00074             }
00075             
00076             result->solver_attempts[plan->tsp_solver] += 1;
00077             printf("TSP Solver Time: %.2f\n", tsp_result.total_time);
00078             result->solver_time[plan->tsp_solver] += tsp_result.total_time;            
00079             
00080             /* Determine if we have found a tour of feasible length or not */
00081             arrow_debug("Found a tour of length %.0f\n", 
00082                         tsp_result.obj_value);
00083             *feasible = fun->feasible(fun, problem, min_cost, max_cost, 
00084                                       tsp_result.obj_value, tsp_result.tour);
00085             if(*feasible)
00086             {
00087                 /* Set this tour to the output variables then exit */
00088                 arrow_debug(" - tour found is feasible.\n");
00089                 result->found_tour = ARROW_TRUE;
00090                 result->min_cost = INT_MAX;
00091                 result->max_cost = INT_MIN;
00092 
00093                 len = 0.0;
00094                 for(k = 0; k < problem->size; k++)
00095                 {
00096                     u = tsp_result.tour[k];
00097                     v = tsp_result.tour[(k + 1) % problem->size];
00098                     cost = problem->get_cost(problem, u, v);
00099                     
00100                     /* See if we've got a better min/max cost */
00101                     if(cost < result->min_cost) result->min_cost = cost;
00102                     if(cost > result->max_cost) result->max_cost = cost;
00103                     
00104                     /* Calculate the actual length of the tour */
00105                     len += cost;
00106                     if(result->tour != NULL)
00107                         result->tour[k] = tsp_result.tour[k];
00108                 }
00109                 arrow_debug(" - actual tour is of length %.0f\n", len);
00110                 result->tour_length = len;
00111                     
00112                 arrow_debug("Finished feasibility question.\n");
00113                 arrow_problem_destruct(&new_problem);
00114                 goto CLEANUP;
00115             }
00116             
00117             /** TODO: Find a better way of doing this upper bound update */
00118             /*
00119             else if(plan->upper_bound_update)
00120             {
00121                 printf("Check to see if we found a better upper bound...\n");
00122                 max_cost = INT_MIN;
00123                 len = 0.0;
00124                 for(k = 0; k < problem->size; k++)
00125                 {
00126                     u = tsp_result.tour[k];
00127                     v = tsp_result.tour[(k + 1) % problem->size];
00128                     cost = problem->get_cost(problem, u, v);
00129                     len += cost;
00130                     if(cost > max_cost) max_cost = cost;
00131                 }
00132                 
00133                 if(max_cost < result->obj_value)
00134                 {
00135                     arrow_debug(" - tour is the best one found so far.\n");
00136                     arrow_debug(" - max. cost is %d\n", max_cost);
00137                     result->found_tour = ARROW_TRUE;
00138                     result->obj_value = max_cost;
00139                     arrow_debug(" - actual tour is of length %.0f\n", len);
00140                     result->tour_length = len;
00141                     if(result->tour != NULL)
00142                     {
00143                         for(k = 0; k < problem->size; k++)
00144                             result->tour[k] = tsp_result.tour[k];
00145                     }
00146                 }
00147             }
00148             */
00149             
00150             /* Clean up */
00151             arrow_problem_destruct(&new_problem);
00152         }
00153     }
00154     arrow_debug("Finished feasibility problem finding no feasible tours.\n");
00155     
00156 CLEANUP:
00157     arrow_tsp_result_destruct(&tsp_result);
00158     return ret;
00159 }
